beyond sad that a tragedy like Michael Brown's death has happened a full 20 
years after the Rodney King beating. Obviously, we still have a lot of 
progress to make. Yet, I don't see how posting a host of racial epithets

police departments. That's because it doesn't help. It's no way to honor 
the memory of Michael Brown, Trayvon Martin, or Rodney King. As tragic as 
these events were, the one silver lining is they've helped bring about 
awareness & change. 

Think about that for a second. This video has 933k views. A lot of people 
who aren't aware of the injustices that African-Americans have to deal with 
on a daily basis are seeing this video. And then what do they see? Hateful, 
foul-mouthed comments from posters that appear to be African-American. You 
have a captive audience. Are racist comments & derogatory, accusatory quips 
the type of impression you want to leave?

of the comments here show disrespect to James Foley. That's when I actually
